cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 330 mi SE of the Mouth of the Rio Grande, western Gulf of Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to meander in the west-central Gulf, then lift generally north-northwest toward the central Texas coast through Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (near Matagorda Bay to Galveston area)
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A – system not forecast to track over or immediately offshore of Port of Pascagoula, MS

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect – only a statement for interests along the western Gulf coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Western Gulf of Mexico coast from Tampico, MX northward to the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: KEESLER AB, MS (Biloxi – closest to Pascagoula)
weather_observation.first_hazard: None expected – only low-end swell/rip-current risk
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of 34-kt gusts late in the 5-day period; otherwise breezy conditions only
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Mississippi coast with present forecast track
weather_observation.rainfall: Light outer-band showers possible early next week; heavy rainfall not expected
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated seas and rip currents along Gulf beaches late weekend into early next week
